Text: ”Give ear, O my people, to my instruction; incline your ears to the words of my mouth.“
Context: The psalmist urges the people to listen to the teaching that will follow, setting the tone for a historical recitation.

Text: ”I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things hidden from of old,“
Context: The speaker announces the use of parables to reveal ancient truths, suggesting a wisdom teaching method.

Text: ”things we have heard and known, that our fathers have relayed to us.“
Context: The historical tradition is emphasized, pointing back to a shared past.

Text: ”We will not hide them from their children, but will tell the coming generation the praiseworthy deeds of the LORD, His power, and the wonders He has performed.“
Context: There’s an intention to pass down the Lord‘s deeds to future generations, reinforcing the purpose of the psalm as a didactic history.

Text: ”He established a testimony in Jacob and set up a law in Israel, which He commanded our forefathers to teach their children,“
Context: The mention of God’s law and testimony given to Jacob and Israel indicates the importance of these teachings.

Text: ”so that the next generation would know them— even the children yet to be born— to arise and tell their own children,“
Context: This verse underlines the continuity of teaching across generations.

Text: ”so that they would put their confidence in God and not forget His deeds, but would keep His commandments.“
Context: It expresses the desired outcome of the teaching: faithfulness and obedience to God.

Text: ”Then they would not be like their fathers— a stubborn and rebellious generation whose hearts were not loyal to God, whose spirits were not faithful to Him.“
Context: The verse serves as a warning against repeating the mistakes of the ancestors.

Text: ”The men of Ephraim, though armed with bows, turned back on the day of battle.“
Context: References the failings of Ephraim to highlight the consequences of disobedience or lack of faith.

Text: ”They did not keep God‘s covenant and refused to walk according to His law.“
Context: Accuses Ephraim of breaking the covenant with God, reinforcing the theme of disobedience.

Verse: (Note: Only portions of Psalm 78 are used as an example. The pattern would continue for all 72 verses of Psalm 78, assessing the polarity, emotion, and intensity of each verse, and providing the quoted text alongside contextual notes for translation efforts.)
